question: Which two countries share the location of the "Nagy-Milic Mountain"?
explanation: Hungary and Slovakia are the two countries that share the location of the "Nagy-Milic Mountain". Nagy-Milic is the highest peak of the Hungarian part of the Zemplen Mountains, which is part of the Carpathian Mountains. The mountain is situated on the border of Hungary and Slovakia. It is 894 metres tall and is near the northernmost point of Hungary.
